alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 2:32PM CDT until March 31 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MCCURTAIN COUNTY... At 231 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles south of Octavia, or 30 miles west of Mena, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotter. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Plunketville, Watson, Bethel, Mount Herman, Smithville and Sherwood. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
